result.execSummary:
The defendant Shane C Roy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1g.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

superMiscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
Pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution.
No violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause. Do not use or possess any illegally controlled substances; random screening.
AODA, programs or treatment as recommended.
Mental health assessment or counseling recommended.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. Defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
Defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the DNA surcharge if not already done. Pay costs, assessments  and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.  Court orders DOC to collect all monetary amounts at the rate of 25% - total - 12 1/2% each count.
Court advised defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime
PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shane C Roy

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Return of petition for sentence adjustment.
Letter in response to defendant's  inquiry about his eligibility for a sentence adjustment.
Letter from defendant regarding eligibility to petition for sentence adjustment.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution; 3) AODA, programs or treatment as recommended; 4) do not use or possess any illegally controlled substances; 5) random screening; 6) mental health assessment or counseling recommended. 

COURT ORDERS:
- DOC to collect all monetary amounts at the rate of 25% - total - 12 1/2% each count;
- defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the DNA surcharge if not already done.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant Shane C Roy in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.   Statements by counsel and defendant.  

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample if not previously provided and pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

Count 3:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 36 months with 95 days credit; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 18 months; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 18 months; pay costs, assessments  and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Count 4:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 24 months; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 12 months; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 12 months - consecutive to Count 3; pay costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program, but is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Defendant Shane C Roy in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Defendant Shane C Roy in custody.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to Counts 3 & 4 and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 3 & 4 as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Shane C Roy not in court, in custody.  William Levins for Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Plea hearing scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Shane C Roy not in court, in custody.  William Levins for Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING  commencing  FEBRUARY 10, 2014 received and filed. (23 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Stephen Sargent - SPD.
Court orders terms and conditions of bail to remain the same.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail AMENDED TO $2,500 CASH.

Defendant Shane C Roy in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Shane C Roy in custody.  Paul Hauer for Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Daniel Knitter-MPD Detective.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #05CF5564 that are attached to the complaint.   Exhibit #1 is marked, offered and received into evidence.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Case is reassigned to Judge Konkol, due to the assignment of the Assistant District Attorney.   Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 44.  Exhibit is ordered withdrawn.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  To be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with co-defendants Amanda Miller and Byron Doyle as well as Randy P.

Defendant Shane C Roy in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Shane C Roy in custody.  William Pipp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
